unmappedEndpoints.summary: Fetch the account specified by the provided Account Sid

parameters.name: Sid
parameters.description: The Account Sid that uniquely identifies the account to fetch

unmappedEndpoints.summary: Retrieve a list of applications representing an application within the requesting account

parameters.name: AccountSid
parameters.description: The SID of the [Account](https://www.twilio.com/docs/iam/api/account) that created the Application resources to read.

parameters.name: FriendlyName
parameters.description: The string that identifies the Application resources to read.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.

parameters.name: Page
parameters.description: The page index. This value is simply for client state.

parameters.name: PageToken
parameters.description: The page token. This is provided by the API.

unmappedEndpoints.summary: Create a new application within your account

parameters.name: AccountSid
parameters.description: The SID of the [Account](https://www.twilio.com/docs/iam/api/account) that will create the resource.

requestBody.name: ApiVersion
requestBody.description: The API version to use to start a new TwiML session. Can be: `2010-04-01` or `2008-08-01`. The default value is the account's default API version.

requestBody.name: VoiceUrl
requestBody.description: The URL we should call when the phone number assigned to this application receives a call.

requestBody.name: VoiceMethod
requestBody.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `voice_url`. Can be: `GET` or `POST`.

requestBody.name: VoiceFallbackUrl
requestBody.description: The URL that we should call when an error occurs retrieving or executing the TwiML requested by `url`.

requestBody.name: VoiceFallbackMethod
requestBody.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `voice_fallback_url`. Can be: `GET` or `POST`.

requestBody.name: StatusCallback
requestBody.description: The URL we should call using the `status_callback_method` to send status information to your application.

requestBody.name: StatusCallbackMethod
requestBody.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `status_callback`. Can be: `GET` or `POST`.

requestBody.name: VoiceCallerIdLookup
requestBody.description: Whether we should look up the caller's caller-ID name from the CNAM database (additional charges apply). Can be: `true` or `false`.

requestBody.name: SmsUrl
requestBody.description: The URL we should call when the phone number receives an incoming SMS message.

requestBody.name: SmsMethod
requestBody.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `sms_url`. Can be: `GET` or `POST`.

requestBody.name: SmsFallbackUrl
requestBody.description: The URL that we should call when an error occurs while retrieving or executing the TwiML from `sms_url`.

requestBody.name: SmsFallbackMethod
requestBody.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `sms_fallback_url`. Can be: `GET` or `POST`.

requestBody.name: SmsStatusCallback
requestBody.description: The URL we should call using a POST method to send status information about SMS messages sent by the application.

requestBody.name: MessageStatusCallback
requestBody.description: The URL we should call using a POST method to send message status information to your application.

requestBody.name: FriendlyName
requestBody.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the new application. It can be up to 64 characters long.

requestBody.name: PublicApplicationConnectEnabled
requestBody.description: Whether to allow other Twilio accounts to dial this applicaton using Dial verb. Can be: `true` or `false`.

requestBody.name: VoiceUrl
requestBody.description: The URL we should call when the phone number assigned to this application receives a call.

requestBody.name: VoiceMethod
requestBody.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `voice_url`. Can be: `GET` or `POST`.

requestBody.name: VoiceFallbackUrl
requestBody.description: The URL that we should call when an error occurs retrieving or executing the TwiML requested by `url`.

requestBody.name: VoiceFallbackMethod

requestBody.description: The URL we should call using the `status_callback_method` to send status information to your application.

requestBody.name: VoiceCallerIdLookup
requestBody.description: Whether we should look up the caller's caller-ID name from the CNAM database (additional charges apply). Can be: `true` or `false`.

requestBody.name: SmsUrl

parameters.name: AccountSid

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.

parameters.description: The page token. This is provided by the API.

parameters.name: AccountSid
parameters.description: The SID of the [Account](https://www.twilio.com/docs/iam/api/account) requesting the available phone number Country resources.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.

parameters.name: Page
parameters.description: The page index. This value is simply for client state.

parameters.name: PageToken
parameters.description: The page token. This is provided by the API.

parameters.name: AccountSid
parameters.description: The SID of the [Account](https://www.twilio.com/docs/iam/api/account) requesting the available phone number Country resource.

parameters.name: CountryCode
parameters.description: The [ISO-3166-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) country code of the country to fetch available phone number information about.

parameters.name: AccountSid
parameters.description: The SID of the [Account](https://www.twilio.com/docs/iam/api/account) requesting the AvailablePhoneNumber resources.

parameters.name: CountryCode
parameters.description: The [ISO-3166-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) country code of the country from which to read phone numbers.

parameters.name: AreaCode
parameters.description: The area code of the phone numbers to read. Applies to only phone numbers in the US and Canada.

parameters.name: Contains
parameters.description: Matching pattern to identify phone numbers. This pattern can be between 2 and 16 characters long and allows all digits (0-9) and all non-diacritic latin alphabet letters (a-z, A-Z). It accepts four meta-characters: `*`, `%`, `+`, `$`. The `*` and `%` meta-characters can appear multiple times in the pattern. To match wildcards at the beginning or end of the pattern, use `*` to match any single character or `%` to match a sequence of characters. If you use the wildcard patterns, it must include at least two non-meta-characters, and wildcards cannot be used between non-meta-characters. To match the beginning of a pattern, start the pattern with `+`. To match the end of the pattern, append the pattern with `$`. These meta-characters can't be adjacent to each other.

parameters.name: SmsEnabled
parameters.description: Whether the phone numbers can receive text messages. Can be: `true` or `false`.

parameters.name: MmsEnabled
parameters.description: Whether the phone numbers can receive MMS messages. Can be: `true` or `false`.

parameters.name: VoiceEnabled
parameters.description: Whether the phone numbers can receive calls. Can be: `true` or `false`.

parameters.name: ExcludeAllAddressRequired
parameters.description: Whether to exclude phone numbers that require an [Address](https://www.twilio.com/docs/usage/api/address). Can be: `true` or `false` and the default is `false`.

parameters.name: ExcludeLocalAddressRequired
parameters.description: Whether to exclude phone numbers that require a local [Address](https://www.twilio.com/docs/usage/api/address). Can be: `true` or `false` and the default is `false`.

parameters.name: ExcludeForeignAddressRequired
parameters.description: Whether to exclude phone numbers that require a foreign [Address](https://www.twilio.com/docs/usage/api/address). Can be: `true` or `false` and the default is `false`.

parameters.name: Beta
parameters.description: Whether to read phone numbers that are new to the Twilio platform. Can be: `true` or `false` and the default is `true`.

parameters.name: NearNumber
parameters.description: Given a phone number, find a geographically close number within `distance` miles. Distance defaults to 25 miles. Applies to only phone numbers in the US and Canada.

parameters.name: NearLatLong
parameters.description: Given a latitude/longitude pair `lat,long` find geographically close numbers within `distance` miles. Applies to only phone numbers in the US and Canada.

parameters.name: Distance
parameters.description: The search radius, in miles, for a `near_` query.  Can be up to `500` and the default is `25`. Applies to only phone numbers in the US and Canada.

parameters.name: InPostalCode
parameters.description: Limit results to a particular postal code. Given a phone number, search within the same postal code as that number. Applies to only phone numbers in the US and Canada.

parameters.name: InRegion
parameters.description: Limit results to a particular region, state, or province. Given a phone number, search within the same region as that number. Applies to only phone numbers in the US and Canada.

parameters.name: InRateCenter
parameters.description: Limit results to a specific rate center, or given a phone number search within the same rate center as that number. Requires `in_lata` to be set as well. Applies to only phone numbers in the US and Canada.

parameters.name: InLata
parameters.description: Limit results to a specific local access and transport area ([LATA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_access_and_transport_area)). Given a phone number, search within the same [LATA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_access_and_transport_area) as that number. Applies to only phone numbers in the US and Canada.

parameters.name: InLocality
parameters.description: Limit results to a particular locality or city. Given a phone number, search within the same Locality as that number.

parameters.name: FaxEnabled
parameters.description: Whether the phone numbers can receive faxes. Can be: `true` or `false`.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.

parameters.name: Page
parameters.description: The page index. This value is simply for client state.

parameters.name: PageToken
parameters.description: The page token. This is provided by the API.

parameters.name: AccountSid
parameters.description: The SID of the [Account](https://www.twilio.com/docs/iam/api/account) requesting the AvailablePhoneNumber resources.

parameters.description: Whether to read phone numbers that are new to the Twilio platform. Can be: `true` or `false` and the default is `true`.

parameters.name: NearNumber
parameters.description: Given a phone number, find a geographically close number within `distance` miles. Distance defaults to 25 miles. Applies to only phone numbers in the US and Canada.

parameters.name: NearLatLong
parameters.description: Given a latitude/longitude pair `lat,long` find geographically close numbers within `distance` miles. Applies to only phone numbers in the US and Canada.

parameters.name: Distance
parameters.description: The search radius, in miles, for a `near_` query.  Can be up to `500` and the default is `25`. Applies to only phone numbers in the US and Canada.

parameters.name: InPostalCode
parameters.description: Limit results to a particular postal code. Given a phone number, search within the same postal code as that number. Applies to only phone numbers in the US and Canada.

parameters.name: InRegion
parameters.description: Limit results to a particular region, state, or province. Given a phone number, search within the same region as that number. Applies to only phone numbers in the US and Canada.

parameters.name: InRateCenter
parameters.description: Limit results to a specific rate center, or given a phone number search within the same rate center as that number. Requires `in_lata` to be set as well. Applies to only phone numbers in the US and Canada.

parameters.name: InLata
parameters.description: Limit results to a specific local access and transport area ([LATA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_access_and_transport_area)). Given a phone number, search within the same [LATA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_access_and_transport_area) as that number. Applies to only phone numbers in the US and Canada.

parameters.name: InLocality
parameters.description: Limit results to a particular locality or city. Given a phone number, search within the same Locality as that number.

parameters.name: FaxEnabled
parameters.description: Whether the phone numbers can receive faxes. Can be: `true` or `false`.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.

parameters.name: Page
parameters.description: The page index. This value is simply for client state.

parameters.name: PageToken
parameters.description: The page token. This is provided by the API.

parameters.name: AccountSid
parameters.description: The SID of the [Account](https://www.twilio.com/docs/iam/api/account) requesting the AvailablePhoneNumber resources.

parameters.name: CountryCode
parameters.description: The [ISO-3166-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) country code of the country from which to read phone numbers.

parameters.name: AreaCode
parameters.description: The area code of the phone numbers to read. Applies to only phone numbers in the US and Canada.

parameters.name: Contains
parameters.description: Matching pattern to identify phone numbers. This pattern can be between 2 and 16 characters long and allows all digits (0-9) and all non-diacritic latin alphabet letters (a-z, A-Z). It accepts four meta-characters: `*`, `%`, `+`, `$`. The `*` and `%` meta-characters can appear multiple times in the pattern. To match wildcards at the beginning or end of the pattern, use `*` to match any single character or `%` to match a sequence of characters. If you use the wildcard patterns, it must include at least two non-meta-characters, and wildcards cannot be used between non-meta-characters. To match the beginning of a pattern, start the pattern with `+`. To match the end of the pattern, append the pattern with `$`. These meta-characters can't be adjacent to each other.

parameters.name: AccountSid
parameters.description: The SID of the [Account](https://www.twilio.com/docs/iam/api/account) that will create the resource.

requestBody.name: ApiVersion
requestBody.description: The API version to use for incoming calls made to the new phone number. The default is `2010-04-01`.

requestBody.name: FriendlyName
requestBody.description: A descriptive string that you created to describe the new phone number. It can be up to 64 characters long. By default, this is a formatted version of the new phone number.

requestBody.name: SmsApplicationSid
requestBody.description: The SID of the application that should handle SMS messages sent to the new phone number. If an `sms_application_sid` is present, we ignore all of the `sms_*_url` urls and use those set on the application.

requestBody.name: SmsFallbackMethod
requestBody.description: The HTTP method that we should use to call `sms_fallback_url`. Can be: `GET` or `POST` and defaults to `POST`.

requestBody.name: SmsFallbackUrl
requestBody.description: The URL that we should call when an error occurs while requesting or executing the TwiML defined by `sms_url`.

requestBody.name: SmsMethod
requestBody.description: The HTTP method that we should use to call `sms_url`. Can be: `GET` or `POST` and defaults to `POST`.

requestBody.name: SmsUrl
requestBody.description: The URL we should call when the new phone number receives an incoming SMS message.

requestBody.name: StatusCallback
requestBody.description: The URL we should call using the `status_callback_method` to send status information to your application.

requestBody.name: StatusCallbackMethod
requestBody.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `status_callback`. Can be: `GET` or `POST` and defaults to `POST`.

requestBody.name: VoiceApplicationSid
requestBody.description: The SID of the application we should use to handle calls to the new phone number. If a `voice_application_sid` is present, we ignore all of the voice urls and use only those set on the application. Setting a `voice_application_sid` will automatically delete your `trunk_sid` and vice versa.

requestBody.name: VoiceCallerIdLookup
requestBody.description: Whether to lookup the caller's name from the CNAM database and post it to your app. Can be: `true` or `false` and defaults to `false`.

requestBody.name: VoiceFallbackMethod
requestBody.description: The HTTP method that we should use to call `voice_fallback_url`. Can be: `GET` or `POST` and defaults to `POST`.

requestBody.name: VoiceFallbackUrl
requestBody.description: The URL that we should call when an error occurs retrieving or executing the TwiML requested by `url`.

requestBody.name: VoiceMethod
requestBody.description: The HTTP method that we should use to call `voice_url`. Can be: `GET` or `POST` and defaults to `POST`.

requestBody.name: VoiceUrl
requestBody.description: The URL that we should call to answer a call to the new phone number. The `voice_url` will not be called if a `voice_application_sid` or a `trunk_sid` is set.

requestBody.name: EmergencyAddressSid
requestBody.description: The SID of the emergency address configuration to use for emergency calling from the new phone number.

requestBody.name: TrunkSid
requestBody.description: The SID of the Trunk we should use to handle calls to the new phone number. If a `trunk_sid` is present, we ignore all of the voice urls and voice applications and use only those set on the Trunk. Setting a `trunk_sid` will automatically delete your `voice_application_sid` and vice versa.

requestBody.name: IdentitySid
requestBody.description: The SID of the Identity resource that we should associate with the new phone number. Some regions require an identity to meet local regulations.

requestBody.name: AddressSid
requestBody.description: The SID of the Address resource we should associate with the new phone number. Some regions require addresses to meet local regulations.

requestBody.name: BundleSid
requestBody.description: The SID of the Bundle resource that you associate with the phone number. Some regions require a Bundle to meet local Regulations.

requestBody.name: PhoneNumber
requestBody.description: The phone number to purchase specified in [E.164](https://www.twilio.com/docs/glossary/what-e164) format.  E.164 phone numbers consist of a + followed by the country code and subscriber number without punctuation characters. For example, +14155551234.

requestBody.name: AreaCode
requestBody.description: The desired area code for your new incoming phone number. Can be any three-digit, US or Canada area code. We will provision an available phone number within this area code for you. **You must provide an `area_code` or a `phone_number`.** (US and Canada only).

requestBody.name: TrunkSid
requestBody.description: The SID of the Trunk we should use to handle calls to the new phone number. If a `trunk_sid` is present, we ignore all of the voice urls and voice applications and use only those set on the Trunk. Setting a `trunk_sid` will automatically delete your `voice_application_sid` and vice versa.

requestBody.name: ApiVersion
requestBody.description: The API version to use for incoming calls made to the new phone number. The default is `2010-04-01`.

requestBody.name: FriendlyName
requestBody.description: A descriptive string that you created to describe the new phone number. It can be up to 64 characters long. By default, the is a formatted version of the phone number.

requestBody.name: SmsApplicationSid

requestBody.name: SmsFallbackMethod

unmappedEndpoints.summary: create an instance of payments. This will start a new payments session

parameters.name: AccountSid
parameters.description: The SID of the [Account](https://www.twilio.com/docs/iam/api/account) that will create the resource.

parameters.name: CallSid
parameters.description: The SID of the call that will create the resource. Call leg associated with this sid is expected to provide payment information thru DTMF.

requestBody.name: IdempotencyKey
requestBody.description: A unique token that will be used to ensure that multiple API calls with the same information do not result in multiple transactions. This should be a unique string value per API call and can be a randomly generated.

requestBody.name: StatusCallback
requestBody.description: Provide an absolute or relative URL to receive status updates regarding your Pay session. Read more about the [expected StatusCallback values](https://www.twilio.com/docs/voice/api/payment-resource#statuscallback)

requestBody.name: ChargeAmount
requestBody.description: A positive decimal value less than 1,000,000 to charge against the credit card or bank account. Default currency can be overwritten with `currency` field. Leave blank or set to 0 to tokenize.

requestBody.name: Currency
requestBody.description: The currency of the `charge_amount`, formatted as [ISO 4127](http://www.iso.org/iso/home/standards/currency_codes.htm) format. The default value is `USD` and all values allowed from the Pay Connector are accepted.

requestBody.name: Description
requestBody.description: The description can be used to provide more details regarding the transaction. This information is submitted along with the payment details to the Payment Connector which are then posted on the transactions.

requestBody.name: Input
requestBody.description: A list of inputs that should be accepted. Currently only `dtmf` is supported. All digits captured during a pay session are redacted from the logs.

requestBody.name: MinPostalCodeLength
requestBody.description: A positive integer that is used to validate the length of the `PostalCode` inputted by the user. User must enter this many digits.

requestBody.name: Parameter
requestBody.description: A single-level JSON object used to pass custom parameters to payment processors. (Required for ACH payments). The information that has to be included here depends on the <Pay> Connector. [Read more](https://www.twilio.com/console/voice/pay-connectors).

requestBody.name: PaymentConnector
requestBody.description: This is the unique name corresponding to the Pay Connector installed in the Twilio Add-ons. Learn more about [<Pay> Connectors](https://www.twilio.com/console/voice/pay-connectors). The default value is `Default`.

requestBody.name: PostalCode
requestBody.description: Indicates whether the credit card postal code (zip code) is a required piece of payment information that must be provided by the caller. The default is `true`.

requestBody.name: SecurityCode
requestBody.description: Indicates whether the credit card security code is a required piece of payment information that must be provided by the caller. The default is `true`.

requestBody.name: Timeout
requestBody.description: The number of seconds that <Pay> should wait for the caller to press a digit between each subsequent digit, after the first one, before moving on to validate the digits captured. The default is `5`, maximum is `600`.

requestBody.name: ValidCardTypes
requestBody.description: Credit card types separated by space that Pay should accept. The default value is `visa mastercard amex`

parameters.description: The SID of the call that will update the resource. This should be the same call sid that was used to create payments resource.

parameters.name: Sid

requestBody.name: IdempotencyKey
requestBody.description: A unique token that will be used to ensure that multiple API calls with the same information do not result in multiple transactions. This should be a unique string value per API call and can be a randomly generated.

requestBody.name: StatusCallback
requestBody.description: Provide an absolute or relative URL to receive status updates regarding your Pay session. Read more about the [Update](https://www.twilio.com/docs/voice/api/payment-resource#statuscallback-update) and [Complete/Cancel](https://www.twilio.com/docs/voice/api/payment-resource#statuscallback-cancelcomplete) POST requests.

parameters.description: The SID of the [Account](https://www.twilio.com/docs/iam/api/account) that will create the resource.

requestBody.name: FriendlyName
requestBody.description: A descriptive string that you created to describe this resource. It can be up to 64 characters long.

requestBody.name: MaxSize

unmappedEndpoints.summary: Create a Transcription

parameters.name: AccountSid
parameters.description: The SID of the [Account](https://www.twilio.com/docs/iam/api/account) that created this Transcription resource.

parameters.name: CallSid
parameters.description: The SID of the [Call](https://www.twilio.com/docs/voice/api/call-resource) the Transcription resource is associated with.

requestBody.name: Name
requestBody.description: The user-specified name of this Transcription, if one was given when the Transcription was created. This may be used to stop the Transcription.

requestBody.name: StatusCallbackUrl
requestBody.description: Absolute URL of the status callback.

requestBody.name: StatusCallbackMethod
requestBody.description: The http method for the status_callback (one of GET, POST).

requestBody.name: InboundTrackLabel
requestBody.description: Friendly name given to the Inbound Track

requestBody.name: OutboundTrackLabel
requestBody.description: Friendly name given to the Outbound Track

requestBody.name: PartialResults
requestBody.description: Indicates if partial results are going to be sent to the customer

requestBody.name: LanguageCode
requestBody.description: Language code used by the transcription engine, specified in [BCP-47](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/bcp/bcp47.txt) format

requestBody.name: TranscriptionEngine
requestBody.description: Definition of the transcription engine to be used, among those supported by Twilio

requestBody.name: ProfanityFilter
requestBody.description: indicates if the server will attempt to filter out profanities, replacing all but the initial character in each filtered word with asterisks

requestBody.name: SpeechModel
requestBody.description: Recognition model used by the transcription engine, among those supported by the provider

requestBody.name: Hints
requestBody.description: A Phrase contains words and phrase "hints" so that the speech recognition engine is more likely to recognize them.

requestBody.name: EnableAutomaticPunctuation
requestBody.description: The provider will add punctuation to recognition result

requestBody.name: IntelligenceService
requestBody.description: The SID or unique name of the [Intelligence Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/conversational-intelligence/api/service-resource) for persisting transcripts and running post-call Language Operators

requestBody.name: EnableProviderData
requestBody.description: Whether the callback includes raw provider data.

unmappedEndpoints.summary: Create a new Domain

parameters.name: AccountSid
parameters.description: The SID of the [Account](https://www.twilio.com/docs/iam/api/account) that will create the resource.

requestBody.name: DomainName
requestBody.description: The unique address you reserve on Twilio to which you route your SIP traffic. Domain names can contain letters, digits, and "-" and must end with `sip.twilio.com`.

requestBody.name: FriendlyName
requestBody.description: A descriptive string that you created to describe the resource. It can be up to 64 characters long.

requestBody.name: VoiceUrl
requestBody.description: The URL we should when the domain receives a call.

requestBody.name: VoiceMethod
requestBody.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `voice_url`. Can be: `GET` or `POST`.

requestBody.name: VoiceFallbackUrl
requestBody.description: The URL that we should call when an error occurs while retrieving or executing the TwiML from `voice_url`.

requestBody.name: VoiceFallbackMethod
requestBody.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `voice_fallback_url`. Can be: `GET` or `POST`.

requestBody.name: VoiceStatusCallbackUrl
requestBody.description: The URL that we should call to pass status parameters (such as call ended) to your application.

requestBody.name: VoiceStatusCallbackMethod
requestBody.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `voice_status_callback_url`. Can be: `GET` or `POST`.

requestBody.name: SipRegistration
requestBody.description: Whether to allow SIP Endpoints to register with the domain to receive calls. Can be `true` or `false`. `true` allows SIP Endpoints to register with the domain to receive calls, `false` does not.

requestBody.name: EmergencyCallingEnabled
requestBody.description: Whether emergency calling is enabled for the domain. If enabled, allows emergency calls on the domain from phone numbers with validated addresses.

requestBody.name: Secure
requestBody.description: Whether secure SIP is enabled for the domain. If enabled, TLS will be enforced and SRTP will be negotiated on all incoming calls to this sip domain.

requestBody.name: ByocTrunkSid
requestBody.description: The SID of the BYOC Trunk(Bring Your Own Carrier) resource that the Sip Domain will be associated with.

requestBody.name: EmergencyCallerSid
requestBody.description: Whether an emergency caller sid is configured for the domain. If present, this phone number will be used as the callback for the emergency call.

requestBody.description: The URL that we should call to pass status parameters (such as call ended) to your application.

requestBody.description: Whether emergency calling is enabled for the domain. If enabled, allows emergency calls on the domain from phone numbers with validated addresses.

unmappedEndpoints.summary: Retrieve a list of transcriptions belonging to the account used to make the request

parameters.name: AccountSid
parameters.description: The SID of the [Account](https://www.twilio.com/docs/iam/api/account) that created the Transcription resources to read.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.

parameters.name: Page
parameters.description: The page index. This value is simply for client state.

parameters.name: PageToken
parameters.description: The page token. This is provided by the API.

parameters.name: AccountSid
parameters.description: The SID of the [Account](https://www.twilio.com/docs/iam/api/account) that created the UsageRecord resources to read.

parameters.name: Category
parameters.description: The [usage category](https://www.twilio.com/docs/usage/api/usage-record#usage-categories) of the UsageRecord resources to read. Only UsageRecord resources in the specified category are retrieved.

parameters.name: StartDate
parameters.description: Only include usage that has occurred on or after this date. Specify the date in GMT and format as `YYYY-MM-DD`. You can also specify offsets from the current date, such as: `-30days`, which will set the start date to be 30 days before the current date.

parameters.name: EndDate
parameters.description: Only include usage that occurred on or before this date. Specify the date in GMT and format as `YYYY-MM-DD`.  You can also specify offsets from the current date, such as: `+30days`, which will set the end date to 30 days from the current date.

parameters.name: IncludeSubaccounts
parameters.description: Whether to include usage from the master account and all its subaccounts. Can be: `true` (the default) to include usage from the master account and all subaccounts or `false` to retrieve usage from only the specified account.

unmappedEndpoints.summary: Create a new User Defined Message for the given Call SID.

parameters.name: AccountSid
parameters.description: The SID of the [Account](https://www.twilio.com/docs/iam/api/account) that created User Defined Message.

parameters.name: CallSid
parameters.description: The SID of the [Call](https://www.twilio.com/docs/voice/api/call-resource) the User Defined Message is associated with.

requestBody.name: Content
requestBody.description: The User Defined Message in the form of URL-encoded JSON string.

requestBody.name: IdempotencyKey
requestBody.description: A unique string value to identify API call. This should be a unique string value per API call and can be a randomly generated.

unmappedEndpoints.summary: Subscribe to User Defined Messages for a given Call SID.

parameters.name: AccountSid
parameters.description: The SID of the [Account](https://www.twilio.com/docs/iam/api/account) that subscribed to the User Defined Messages.

parameters.name: CallSid
parameters.description: The SID of the [Call](https://www.twilio.com/docs/voice/api/call-resource) the User Defined Messages subscription is associated with. This refers to the Call SID that is producing the user defined messages.

requestBody.name: Callback
requestBody.description: The URL we should call using the `method` to send user defined events to your application. URLs must contain a valid hostname (underscores are not permitted).

requestBody.name: IdempotencyKey
requestBody.description: A unique string value to identify API call. This should be a unique string value per API call and can be a randomly generated.

requestBody.name: Method
requestBody.description: The HTTP method Twilio will use when requesting the above `Url`. Either `GET` or `POST`. Default is `POST`.

unmappedEndpoints.summary: Delete a specific User Defined Message Subscription.

parameters.name: AccountSid
parameters.description: The SID of the [Account](https://www.twilio.com/docs/iam/api/account) that subscribed to the User Defined Messages.

parameters.name: CallSid
parameters.description: The SID of the [Call](https://www.twilio.com/docs/voice/api/call-resource) the User Defined Message Subscription is associated with. This refers to the Call SID that is producing the User Defined Messages.

parameters.name: Sid

requestBody.name: Description
requestBody.description: A short description of what this SMS campaign does. Min length: 40 characters. Max length: 4096 characters.

requestBody.name: MessageFlow
requestBody.description: Required for all Campaigns. Details around how a consumer opts-in to their campaign, therefore giving consent to receive their messages. If multiple opt-in methods can be used for the same campaign, they must all be listed. 40 character minimum. 2048 character maximum.

requestBody.name: MessageSamples
requestBody.description: An array of sample message strings, min two and max five. Min length for each sample: 20 chars. Max length for each sample: 1024 chars.

requestBody.name: UsAppToPersonUsecase
requestBody.description: A2P Campaign Use Case. Examples: [ 2FA, EMERGENCY, MARKETING..]

requestBody.name: HasEmbeddedLinks
requestBody.description: Indicates that this SMS campaign will send messages that contain links.

requestBody.name: HasEmbeddedPhone
requestBody.description: Indicates that this SMS campaign will send messages that contain phone numbers.

requestBody.name: OptInMessage
requestBody.description: If end users can text in a keyword to start receiving messages from this campaign, the auto-reply messages sent to the end users must be provided. The opt-in response should include the Brand name, confirmation of opt-in enrollment to a recurring message campaign, how to get help, and clear description of how to opt-out. This field is required if end users can text in a keyword to start receiving messages from this campaign. 20 character minimum. 320 character maximum.

requestBody.name: OptOutMessage
requestBody.description: Upon receiving the opt-out keywords from the end users, Twilio customers are expected to send back an auto-generated response, which must provide acknowledgment of the opt-out request and confirmation that no further messages will be sent. It is also recommended that these opt-out messages include the brand name. This field is required if managing opt out keywords yourself (i.e. not using Twilio's Default or Advanced Opt Out features). 20 character minimum. 320 character maximum.

requestBody.name: HelpMessage
requestBody.description: When customers receive the help keywords from their end users, Twilio customers are expected to send back an auto-generated response; this may include the brand name and additional support contact information. This field is required if managing help keywords yourself (i.e. not using Twilio's Default or Advanced Opt Out features). 20 character minimum. 320 character maximum.

requestBody.name: OptInKeywords
requestBody.description: If end users can text in a keyword to start receiving messages from this campaign, those keywords must be provided. This field is required if end users can text in a keyword to start receiving messages from this campaign. Values must be alphanumeric. 255 character maximum.

requestBody.name: OptOutKeywords
requestBody.description: End users should be able to text in a keyword to stop receiving messages from this campaign. Those keywords must be provided. This field is required if managing opt out keywords yourself (i.e. not using Twilio's Default or Advanced Opt Out features). Values must be alphanumeric. 255 character maximum.

requestBody.name: HelpKeywords
requestBody.description: End users should be able to text in a keyword to receive help. Those keywords must be provided as part of the campaign registration request. This field is required if managing help keywords yourself (i.e. not using Twilio's Default or Advanced Opt Out features). Values must be alphanumeric. 255 character maximum.

requestBody.name: SubscriberOptIn
requestBody.description: A boolean that specifies whether campaign has Subscriber Optin or not.

requestBody.name: AgeGated
requestBody.description: A boolean that specifies whether campaign is age gated or not.

requestBody.name: DirectLending
requestBody.description: A boolean that specifies whether campaign allows direct lending or not.

This identifier should be immutable, not PII, length between 8 and 64 characters, and generated by your external system, such as your user's UUID, GUID, or SID. It can only contain dash (-) separated alphanumeric characters.

parameters.name: FactorSid
parameters.description: The unique SID identifier of the Factor.

parameters.name: Status
parameters.description: The Status of the Challenges to fetch. One of `pending`, `expired`, `approved` or `denied`.

parameters.name: Order
parameters.description: The desired sort order of the Challenges list. One of `asc` or `desc` for ascending and descending respectively. Defaults to `asc`.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.

parameters.name: Page
parameters.description: The page index. This value is simply for client state.

parameters.name: PageToken
parameters.description: The page token. This is provided by the API.

unmappedEndpoints.summary: Create a new Challenge for the Factor

parameters.name: ServiceSid
parameters.description: The unique SID identifier of the Service.

parameters.name: Identity
parameters.description: Customer unique identity for the Entity owner of the Challenge. This identifier should be immutable, not PII, length between 8 and 64 characters, and generated by your external system, such as your user's UUID, GUID, or SID. It can only contain dash (-) separated alphanumeric characters.

requestBody.name: FactorSid
requestBody.description: The unique SID identifier of the Factor.

requestBody.name: ExpirationDate
requestBody.description: The date-time when this Challenge expires, given in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format. The default value is five (5) minutes after Challenge creation. The max value is sixty (60) minutes after creation.

requestBody.name: Details.Message
requestBody.description: Shown to the user when the push notification arrives. Required when `factor_type` is `push`. Can be up to 256 characters in length

requestBody.name: Details.Fields
requestBody.description: A list of objects that describe the Fields included in the Challenge. Each object contains the label and value of the field, the label can be up to 36 characters in length and the value can be up to 128 characters in length. Used when `factor_type` is `push`. There can be up to 20 details fields.

requestBody.name: HiddenDetails
requestBody.description: Details provided to give context about the Challenge. Not shown to the end user. It must be a stringified JSON with only strings values eg. `{"ip": "172.168.1.234"}`. Can be up to 1024 characters in length

requestBody.name: AuthPayload
requestBody.description: Optional payload used to verify the Challenge upon creation. Only used with a Factor of type `totp` to carry the TOTP code that needs to be verified. For `TOTP` this value must be between 3 and 8 characters long.

unmappedEndpoints.summary: Fetch a specific Challenge.

parameters.name: ServiceSid
parameters.description: The unique SID identifier of the Service.

parameters.name: Identity
parameters.description: Customer unique identity for the Entity owner of the Challenges. This identifier should be immutable, not PII, length between 8 and 64 characters, and generated by your external system, such as your user's UUID, GUID, or SID. It can only contain dash (-) separated alphanumeric characters.

parameters.name: Sid
parameters.description: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this Challenge.

unmappedEndpoints.summary: Verify a specific Challenge.

parameters.name: ServiceSid
parameters.description: The unique SID identifier of the Service.

parameters.name: Identity
parameters.description: Customer unique identity for the Entity owner of the Challenge. This identifier should be immutable, not PII, length between 8 and 64 characters, and generated by your external system, such as your user's UUID, GUID, or SID. It can only contain dash (-) separated alphanumeric characters.

parameters.name: Sid
parameters.description: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this Challenge.

requestBody.name: AuthPayload
requestBody.description: The optional payload needed to verify the Challenge. E.g., a TOTP would use the numeric code. For `TOTP` this value must be between 3 and 8 characters long. For `Push` this value can be up to 5456 characters in length

requestBody.name: Metadata
requestBody.description: Custom metadata associated with the challenge. This is added by the Device/SDK directly to allow for the inclusion of device information. It must be a stringified JSON with only strings values eg. `{"os": "Android"}`. Can be up to 1024 characters in length.

parameters.description: Customer unique identity for the Entity owner of the Factor. This identifier should be immutable, not PII, length between 8 and 64 characters, and generated by your external system, such as your user's UUID, GUID, or SID. It can only contain dash (-) separated alphanumeric characters.

parameters.name: Sid
parameters.description: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this Factor.

requestBody.name: AuthPayload
requestBody.description: The optional payload needed to verify the Factor for the first time. E.g. for a TOTP, the numeric code.

requestBody.name: FriendlyName
requestBody.description: The new friendly name of this Factor. It can be up to 64 characters.

requestBody.name: Config.NotificationToken
requestBody.description: For APN, the device token. For FCM, the registration token. It is used to send the push notifications. Required when `factor_type` is `push`. If specified, this value must be between 32 and 255 characters long.

requestBody.name: Config.SdkVersion
requestBody.description: The Verify Push SDK version used to configure the factor

requestBody.name: Config.TimeStep
requestBody.description: Defines how often, in seconds, are TOTP codes generated. i.e, a new TOTP code is generated every time_step seconds. Must be between 20 and 60 seconds, inclusive

requestBody.name: Config.Skew
requestBody.description: The number of time-steps, past and future, that are valid for validation of TOTP codes. Must be between 0 and 2, inclusive

requestBody.name: Config.CodeLength
requestBody.description: Number of digits for generated TOTP codes. Must be between 3 and 8, inclusive

requestBody.name: Config.NotificationPlatform
requestBody.description:
The transport technology used to generate the Notification Token. Can be `apn`, `fcm` or `none`.

Required when `factor_type` is `push`.

parameters.name: Identity
parameters.description: Customer unique identity for the Entity owner of the Factors. This identifier should be immutable, not PII, length between 8 and 64 characters, and generated by your external system, such as your user's UUID, GUID, or SID. It can only contain dash (-) separated alphanumeric characters.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.

unmappedEndpoints.summary: Create a new Factor for the Entity

parameters.name: ServiceSid
parameters.description: The unique SID identifier of the Service.

parameters.name: Identity
parameters.description: Customer unique identity for the Entity owner of the Factor. This identifier should be immutable, not PII, length between 8 and 64 characters, and generated by your external system, such as your user's UUID, GUID, or SID. It can only contain dash (-) separated alphanumeric characters.

requestBody.name: FriendlyName
requestBody.description:
The friendly name of this Factor. This can be any string up to 64 characters, meant for humans to distinguish between Factors.
For `factor_type` `push`, this could be a device name.
For `factor_type` `totp`, this value is used as the account name in constructing the `binding.uri` property.
At the same time, we recommend avoiding providing PII.

requestBody.name: Binding.Alg
requestBody.description: The algorithm used when `factor_type` is `push`. Algorithm supported: `ES256`

requestBody.name: Binding.PublicKey
requestBody.description:
The Ecdsa public key in PKIX, ASN.1 DER format encoded in Base64.

Required when `factor_type` is `push`

requestBody.name: Config.AppId
requestBody.description:
The ID that uniquely identifies your app in the Google or Apple store, such as `com.example.myapp`. It can be up to 100 characters long.

Required when `factor_type` is `push`.

requestBody.name: Config.NotificationToken
requestBody.description:
For APN, the device token. For FCM, the registration token. It is used to send the push notifications. Must be between 32 and 255 characters long.

Required when `factor_type` is `push`.

requestBody.name: Config.SdkVersion
requestBody.description:
The Verify Push SDK version used to configure the factor

Required when `factor_type` is `push`

requestBody.name: Binding.Secret
requestBody.description:
The shared secret for TOTP factors encoded in Base32. This can be provided when creating the Factor, otherwise it will be generated.

Used when `factor_type` is `totp`

requestBody.name: Config.TimeStep
requestBody.description:
Defines how often, in seconds, are TOTP codes generated. i.e, a new TOTP code is generated every time_step seconds. Must be between 20 and 60 seconds, inclusive. The default value is defined at the service level in the property `totp.time_step`. Defaults to 30 seconds if not configured.

Used when `factor_type` is `totp`

requestBody.name: Config.Skew
requestBody.description:
The number of time-steps, past and future, that are valid for validation of TOTP codes. Must be between 0 and 2, inclusive. The default value is defined at the service level in the property `totp.skew`. If not configured defaults to 1.

Used when `factor_type` is `totp`

requestBody.name: Config.CodeLength
requestBody.description:
Number of digits for generated TOTP codes. Must be between 3 and 8, inclusive. The default value is defined at the service level in the property `totp.code_length`. If not configured defaults to 6.

Used when `factor_type` is `totp`

requestBody.name: Metadata
requestBody.description: Custom metadata associated with the factor. This is added by the Device/SDK directly to allow for the inclusion of device information. It must be a stringified JSON with only strings values eg. `{"os": "Android"}`. Can be up to 1024 characters in length.

unmappedEndpoints.summary: Create a new Verification Service.

requestBody.name: FriendlyName
requestBody.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the verification service. It can be up to 32 characters long. **This value should not contain PII.**

requestBody.name: CodeLength
requestBody.description: The length of the verification code to generate. Must be an integer value between 4 and 10, inclusive.

requestBody.name: LookupEnabled
requestBody.description: Whether to perform a lookup with each verification started and return info about the phone number.

requestBody.name: SkipSmsToLandlines
requestBody.description: Whether to skip sending SMS verifications to landlines. Requires `lookup_enabled`.

requestBody.name: DtmfInputRequired
requestBody.description: Whether to ask the user to press a number before delivering the verify code in a phone call.

requestBody.name: TtsName
requestBody.description: The name of an alternative text-to-speech service to use in phone calls. Applies only to TTS languages.

requestBody.name: Psd2Enabled
requestBody.description: Whether to pass PSD2 transaction parameters when starting a verification.

requestBody.name: DoNotShareWarningEnabled
requestBody.description: Whether to add a security warning at the end of an SMS verification body. Disabled by default and applies only to SMS. Example SMS body: `Your AppName verification code is: 1234. Dont share this code with anyone; our employees will never ask for the code`

requestBody.name: CustomCodeEnabled
requestBody.description: Whether to allow sending verifications with a custom code instead of a randomly generated one.

requestBody.name: Push.IncludeDate
requestBody.description: Optional configuration for the Push factors. If true, include the date in the Challenge's response. Otherwise, the date is omitted from the response. See [Challenge](https://www.twilio.com/docs/verify/api/challenge) resources details parameter for more info. Default: false. **Deprecated** do not use this parameter. This timestamp value is the same one as the one found in `date_created`, please use that one instead.

requestBody.name: Push.ApnCredentialSid
requestBody.description: Optional configuration for the Push factors. Set the APN Credential for this service. This will allow to send push notifications to iOS devices. See [Credential Resource](https://www.twilio.com/docs/notify/api/credential-resource)

requestBody.name: Push.FcmCredentialSid
requestBody.description: Optional configuration for the Push factors. Set the FCM Credential for this service. This will allow to send push notifications to Android devices. See [Credential Resource](https://www.twilio.com/docs/notify/api/credential-resource)

requestBody.name: Totp.Issuer
requestBody.description: Optional configuration for the TOTP factors. Set TOTP Issuer for this service. This will allow to configure the issuer of the TOTP URI. Defaults to the service friendly name if not provided.

requestBody.name: Totp.TimeStep
requestBody.description: Optional configuration for the TOTP factors. Defines how often, in seconds, are TOTP codes generated. i.e, a new TOTP code is generated every time_step seconds. Must be between 20 and 60 seconds, inclusive. Defaults to 30 seconds

requestBody.name: Totp.CodeLength
requestBody.description: Optional configuration for the TOTP factors. Number of digits for generated TOTP codes. Must be between 3 and 8, inclusive. Defaults to 6

requestBody.name: Totp.Skew
requestBody.description: Optional configuration for the TOTP factors. The number of time-steps, past and future, that are valid for validation of TOTP codes. Must be between 0 and 2, inclusive. Defaults to 1

requestBody.name: DefaultTemplateSid
requestBody.description: The default message [template](https://www.twilio.com/docs/verify/api/templates). Will be used for all SMS verifications unless explicitly overriden. SMS channel only.

requestBody.name: Whatsapp.MsgServiceSid
requestBody.description: The SID of the Messaging Service containing WhatsApp Sender(s) that Verify will use to send WhatsApp messages to your users.

requestBody.name: Whatsapp.From
requestBody.description: The number to use as the WhatsApp Sender that Verify will use to send WhatsApp messages to your users.This WhatsApp Sender must be associated with a Messaging Service SID.

requestBody.name: Passkeys.RelyingParty.Id
requestBody.description: The Relying Party ID for Passkeys. This is the domain of your application, e.g. `example.com`. It is used to identify your application when creating Passkeys.

requestBody.name: Passkeys.RelyingParty.Name
requestBody.description: The Relying Party Name for Passkeys. This is the name of your application, e.g. `Example App`. It is used to identify your application when creating Passkeys.

requestBody.name: Passkeys.RelyingParty.Origins
requestBody.description: The Relying Party Origins for Passkeys. This is the origin of your application, e.g. `login.example.com,www.example.com`. It is used to identify your application when creating Passkeys, it can have multiple origins split by `,`.

requestBody.name: Passkeys.AuthenticatorAttachment

requestBody.name: Passkeys.DiscoverableCredentials
requestBody.description: Indicates whether credentials must be discoverable by the authenticator. It can be empty or it can have the values `required`, `preferred` or `discouraged`.

requestBody.name: Passkeys.UserVerification
requestBody.description: The User Verification for Passkeys. This is the type of user verification that will be used to create Passkeys. It can be empty or it can have the values `required`, `preferred` or `discouraged`.

requestBody.name: FriendlyName
requestBody.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the verification service. It can be up to 32 characters long. **This value should not contain PII.**

requestBody.name: CodeLength
requestBody.description: The length of the verification code to generate. Must be an integer value between 4 and 10, inclusive.

requestBody.name: LookupEnabled
requestBody.description: Whether to perform a lookup with each verification started and return info about the phone number.

requestBody.name: SkipSmsToLandlines
requestBody.description: Whether to skip sending SMS verifications to landlines. Requires `lookup_enabled`.

requestBody.name: DtmfInputRequired
requestBody.description: Whether to ask the user to press a number before delivering the verify code in a phone call.

requestBody.name: TtsName
requestBody.description: The name of an alternative text-to-speech service to use in phone calls. Applies only to TTS languages.

requestBody.name: Psd2Enabled
requestBody.description: Whether to pass PSD2 transaction parameters when starting a verification.

requestBody.name: DoNotShareWarningEnabled
requestBody.description: Whether to add a privacy warning at the end of an SMS. **Disabled by default and applies only for SMS.**

requestBody.name: CustomCodeEnabled
requestBody.description: Whether to allow sending verifications with a custom code instead of a randomly generated one.

requestBody.name: Push.IncludeDate
requestBody.description: Optional configuration for the Push factors. If true, include the date in the Challenge's response. Otherwise, the date is omitted from the response. See [Challenge](https://www.twilio.com/docs/verify/api/challenge) resources details parameter for more info. Default: false. **Deprecated** do not use this parameter.

requestBody.name: Push.ApnCredentialSid
requestBody.description: Optional configuration for the Push factors. Set the APN Credential for this service. This will allow to send push notifications to iOS devices. See [Credential Resource](https://www.twilio.com/docs/notify/api/credential-resource)

requestBody.name: Push.FcmCredentialSid
requestBody.description: Optional configuration for the Push factors. Set the FCM Credential for this service. This will allow to send push notifications to Android devices. See [Credential Resource](https://www.twilio.com/docs/notify/api/credential-resource)

requestBody.name: Totp.Issuer
requestBody.description: Optional configuration for the TOTP factors. Set TOTP Issuer for this service. This will allow to configure the issuer of the TOTP URI.

requestBody.name: Totp.TimeStep
requestBody.description: Optional configuration for the TOTP factors. Defines how often, in seconds, are TOTP codes generated. i.e, a new TOTP code is generated every time_step seconds. Must be between 20 and 60 seconds, inclusive. Defaults to 30 seconds

requestBody.name: Totp.CodeLength
requestBody.description: Optional configuration for the TOTP factors. Number of digits for generated TOTP codes. Must be between 3 and 8, inclusive. Defaults to 6

requestBody.name: Totp.Skew
requestBody.description: Optional configuration for the TOTP factors. The number of time-steps, past and future, that are valid for validation of TOTP codes. Must be between 0 and 2, inclusive. Defaults to 1

requestBody.name: DefaultTemplateSid
requestBody.description: The default message [template](https://www.twilio.com/docs/verify/api/templates). Will be used for all SMS verifications unless explicitly overriden. SMS channel only.

requestBody.name: Whatsapp.MsgServiceSid
requestBody.description: The SID of the [Messaging Service](https://www.twilio.com/docs/messaging/services) to associate with the Verification Service.

requestBody.name: Whatsapp.From
requestBody.description: The WhatsApp number to use as the sender of the verification messages. This number must be associated with the WhatsApp Message Service.

requestBody.name: Passkeys.RelyingParty.Id
requestBody.description: The Relying Party ID for Passkeys. This is the domain of your application, e.g. `example.com`. It is used to identify your application when creating Passkeys.

requestBody.name: Passkeys.RelyingParty.Name
requestBody.description: The Relying Party Name for Passkeys. This is the name of your application, e.g. `Example App`. It is used to identify your application when creating Passkeys.

requestBody.name: WebhookUrl
requestBody.description: The URL we should call when Sync objects are manipulated.

requestBody.name: FriendlyName
requestBody.description: A string that you assign to describe the resource.

requestBody.name: ReachabilityWebhooksEnabled
requestBody.description: Whether the service instance should call `webhook_url` when client endpoints connect to Sync. The default is `false`.

requestBody.name: AclEnabled
requestBody.description: Whether token identities in the Service must be granted access to Sync objects by using the [Permissions](https://www.twilio.com/docs/sync/api/sync-permissions) resource.

requestBody.name: ReachabilityDebouncingEnabled
requestBody.description: Whether every `endpoint_disconnected` event should occur after a configurable delay. The default is `false`, where the `endpoint_disconnected` event occurs immediately after disconnection. When `true`, intervening reconnections can prevent the `endpoint_disconnected` event.

requestBody.name: ReachabilityDebouncingWindow
requestBody.description: The reachability event delay in milliseconds if `reachability_debouncing_enabled` = `true`.  Must be between 1,000 and 30,000 and defaults to 5,000. This is the number of milliseconds after the last running client disconnects, and a Sync identity is declared offline, before the webhook is called if all endpoints remain offline. A reconnection from the same identity by any endpoint during this interval prevents the webhook from being called.

requestBody.name: WebhooksFromRestEnabled
requestBody.description: Whether the Service instance should call `webhook_url` when the REST API is used to update Sync objects. The default is `false`.

requestBody.description: Whether token identities in the Service must be granted access to Sync objects by using the [Permissions](https://www.twilio.com/docs/sync/api/sync-permissions) resource.

requestBody.name: ReachabilityDebouncingEnabled
requestBody.description: Whether every `endpoint_disconnected` event should occur after a configurable delay. The default is `false`, where the `endpoint_disconnected` event occurs immediately after disconnection. When `true`, intervening reconnections can prevent the `endpoint_disconnected` event.

requestBody.name: ReachabilityDebouncingWindow
requestBody.description: The reachability event delay in milliseconds if `reachability_debouncing_enabled` = `true`.  Must be between 1,000 and 30,000 and defaults to 5,000. This is the number of milliseconds after the last running client disconnects, and a Sync identity is declared offline, before the `webhook_url` is called if all endpoints remain offline. A reconnection from the same identity by any endpoint during this interval prevents the call to `webhook_url`.

parameters.name: StartDate

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: If provided, applies this mutation if (and only if) the [ETag](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/ETag) header of the Task matches the provided value. This matches the semantics of (and is implemented with) the HTTP [If-Match header](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/If-Match).

requestBody.name: Attributes
requestBody.description: The JSON string that describes the custom attributes of the task.

requestBody.name: Reason
requestBody.description: The reason that the Task was canceled or completed. This parameter is required only if the Task is canceled or completed. Setting this value queues the task for deletion and logs the reason.

requestBody.name: Priority
requestBody.description: The Task's new priority value. When supplied, the Task takes on the specified priority unless it matches a Workflow Target with a Priority set. Value can be 0 to 2^31^ (2,147,483,647).

requestBody.name: TaskChannel
requestBody.description: When MultiTasking is enabled, specify the TaskChannel with the task to update. Can be the TaskChannel's SID or its `unique_name`, such as `voice`, `sms`, or `default`.

requestBody.name: VirtualStartTime
requestBody.description: The task's new virtual start time value. When supplied, the Task takes on the specified virtual start time. Value can't be in the future or before the year of 1900.

This matches the semantics of (and is implemented with) the HTTP [If-Match header](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/If-Match).

If this value is empty, Tasks will wait in the TaskQueue until they are deleted or moved to another TaskQueue. For more information about Worker selection, see [Describing Worker selection criteria](https://www.twilio.com/docs/taskrouter/api/taskqueues#target-workers).

parameters.name: EndDate
parameters.description: Only calculate statistics from this date and time and earlier, specified in GMT as an [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) date-time.

parameters.name: Minutes
parameters.description: Only calculate statistics since this many minutes in the past. The default is 15 minutes.

parameters.name: StartDate
parameters.description: Only calculate statistics from this date and time and later, specified in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.

parameters.name: TaskChannel
parameters.description: Only calculate cumulative statistics on this TaskChannel. Can be the TaskChannel's SID or its `unique_name`, such as `voice`, `sms`, or `default`.

parameters.name: SplitByWaitTime
parameters.description: A comma separated list of values that describes the thresholds, in seconds, to calculate statistics on. For each threshold specified, the number of Tasks canceled and reservations accepted above and below the specified thresholds in seconds are computed. TaskRouter will calculate statistics on up to 10,000 Tasks/Reservations for any given threshold.

requestBody.name: WorkerActivitySid
requestBody.description: The new worker activity SID if rejecting a reservation.

requestBody.name: Instruction
requestBody.description: The assignment instruction for reservation.

requestBody.name: DequeuePostWorkActivitySid
requestBody.description: The SID of the Activity resource to start after executing a Dequeue instruction.

requestBody.name: DequeueFrom
requestBody.description: The Caller ID of the call to the worker when executing a Dequeue instruction.

requestBody.name: DequeueRecord
requestBody.description: Whether to record both legs of a call when executing a Dequeue instruction or which leg to record.

requestBody.name: DequeueTimeout
requestBody.description: Timeout for call when executing a Dequeue instruction.

requestBody.name: DequeueTo
requestBody.description: The Contact URI of the worker when executing a Dequeue instruction. Can be the URI of the Twilio Client, the SIP URI for Programmable SIP, or the [E.164](https://www.twilio.com/docs/glossary/what-e164) formatted phone number, depending on the destination.

requestBody.name: DequeueStatusCallbackUrl
requestBody.description: The Callback URL for completed call event when executing a Dequeue instruction.

requestBody.name: CallFrom
requestBody.description: The Caller ID of the outbound call when executing a Call instruction.

requestBody.name: CallRecord
requestBody.description: Whether to record both legs of a call when executing a Call instruction or which leg to record.

requestBody.name: CallTimeout
requestBody.description: Timeout for call when executing a Call instruction.

requestBody.name: CallTo
requestBody.description: The Contact URI of the worker when executing a Call instruction.  Can be the URI of the Twilio Client, the SIP URI for Programmable SIP, or the [E.164](https://www.twilio.com/docs/glossary/what-e164) formatted phone number, depending on the destination.

requestBody.name: CallUrl
requestBody.description: TwiML URI executed on answering the worker's leg as a result of the Call instruction.

requestBody.name: CallStatusCallbackUrl
requestBody.description: The URL to call  for the completed call event when executing a Call instruction.

requestBody.name: CallAccept
requestBody.description: Whether to accept a reservation when executing a Call instruction.

requestBody.name: RedirectCallSid
requestBody.description: The Call SID of the call parked in the queue when executing a Redirect instruction.

requestBody.name: RedirectAccept
requestBody.description: Whether the reservation should be accepted when executing a Redirect instruction.

requestBody.name: RedirectUrl
requestBody.description: TwiML URI to redirect the call to when executing the Redirect instruction.

requestBody.name: To
requestBody.description: The Contact URI of the worker when executing a Conference instruction. Can be the URI of the Twilio Client, the SIP URI for Programmable SIP, or the [E.164](https://www.twilio.com/docs/glossary/what-e164) formatted phone number, depending on the destination.

requestBody.name: From
requestBody.description: The Caller ID of the call to the worker when executing a Conference instruction.

requestBody.name: StatusCallback
requestBody.description: The URL we should call using the `status_callback_method` to send status information to your application.

requestBody.name: StatusCallbackMethod
requestBody.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `status_callback`. Can be: `POST` or `GET` and the default is `POST`.

requestBody.name: StatusCallbackEvent
requestBody.description: The call progress events that we will send to `status_callback`. Can be: `initiated`, `ringing`, `answered`, or `completed`.

requestBody.name: Timeout
requestBody.description: Timeout for call when executing a Conference instruction.

requestBody.name: Record
requestBody.description: Whether to record the participant and their conferences, including the time between conferences. The default is `false`.

requestBody.name: Muted
requestBody.description: Whether the agent is muted in the conference. The default is `false`.

requestBody.name: Beep
requestBody.description: Whether to play a notification beep when the participant joins or when to play a beep. Can be: `true`, `false`, `onEnter`, or `onExit`. The default value is `true`.

requestBody.name: StartConferenceOnEnter
requestBody.description: Whether to start the conference when the participant joins, if it has not already started. The default is `true`. If `false` and the conference has not started, the participant is muted and hears background music until another participant starts the conference.

requestBody.name: EndConferenceOnExit
requestBody.description: Whether to end the conference when the agent leaves.

requestBody.name: WaitUrl
requestBody.description: The URL we should call using the `wait_method` for the music to play while participants are waiting for the conference to start. The default value is the URL of our standard hold music. [Learn more about hold music](https://www.twilio.com/labs/twimlets/holdmusic).

requestBody.name: WaitMethod
requestBody.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `wait_url`. Can be `GET` or `POST` and the default is `POST`. When using a static audio file, this should be `GET` so that we can cache the file.

requestBody.name: EarlyMedia
requestBody.description: Whether to allow an agent to hear the state of the outbound call, including ringing or disconnect messages. The default is `true`.

requestBody.name: MaxParticipants

parameters.name: SplitByWaitTime
parameters.description: A comma separated list of values that describes the thresholds, in seconds, to calculate statistics on. For each threshold specified, the number of Tasks canceled and reservations accepted above and below the specified thresholds in seconds are computed. For example, `5,30` would show splits of Tasks that were canceled or accepted before and after 5 seconds and before and after 30 seconds. This can be used to show short abandoned Tasks or Tasks that failed to meet an SLA. TaskRouter will calculate statistics on up to 10,000 Tasks for any given threshold.

requestBody.name: DefaultActivitySid
requestBody.description: The SID of the Activity that will be used when new Workers are created in the Workspace.

requestBody.name: EventCallbackUrl
requestBody.description: The URL we should call when an event occurs. See [Workspace Events](https://www.twilio.com/docs/taskrouter/api/event) for more information. This parameter supports Twilio's [Webhooks (HTTP callbacks) Connection Overrides](https://www.twilio.com/docs/usage/webhooks/webhooks-connection-overrides).

requestBody.name: EventsFilter
requestBody.description: The list of Workspace events for which to call event_callback_url. For example if `EventsFilter=task.created,task.canceled,worker.activity.update`, then TaskRouter will call event_callback_url only when a task is created, canceled, or a Worker activity is updated.

requestBody.name: FriendlyName
requestBody.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the Workspace resource. For example: `Sales Call Center` or `Customer Support Team`.

requestBody.name: MultiTaskEnabled
requestBody.description: Whether to enable multi-tasking. Can be: `true` to enable multi-tasking, or `false` to disable it. However, all workspaces should be maintained as multi-tasking. There is no default when omitting this parameter. A multi-tasking Workspace can't be updated to single-tasking unless it is not a Flex Project and another (legacy) single-tasking Workspace exists. Multi-tasking allows Workers to handle multiple Tasks simultaneously. In multi-tasking mode, each Worker can receive parallel reservations up to the per-channel maximums defined in the Workers section. In single-tasking mode (legacy mode), each Worker will only receive a new reservation when the previous task is completed. Learn more at [Multitasking](https://www.twilio.com/docs/taskrouter/multitasking).

requestBody.description: The SID of the Activity that will be assigned to a Worker when a Task reservation times out without a response.

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.

parameters.name: Page
parameters.description: The page index. This value is simply for client state.

parameters.name: PageToken
parameters.description: The page token. This is provided by the API.

requestBody.name: FriendlyName
requestBody.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the Workspace resource. It can be up to 64 characters long. For example: `Customer Support` or `2014 Election Campaign`.

requestBody.name: EventCallbackUrl
requestBody.description: The URL we should call when an event occurs. If provided, the Workspace will publish events to this URL, for example, to collect data for reporting. See [Workspace Events](https://www.twilio.com/docs/taskrouter/api/event) for more information. This parameter supports Twilio's [Webhooks (HTTP callbacks) Connection Overrides](https://www.twilio.com/docs/usage/webhooks/webhooks-connection-overrides).

requestBody.name: EventsFilter
requestBody.description: The list of Workspace events for which to call event_callback_url. For example, if `EventsFilter=task.created, task.canceled, worker.activity.update`, then TaskRouter will call event_callback_url only when a task is created, canceled, or a Worker activity is updated.

requestBody.name: MultiTaskEnabled
requestBody.description: Whether to enable multi-tasking. Can be: `true` to enable multi-tasking, or `false` to disable it. However, all workspaces should be created as multi-tasking. The default is `true`. Multi-tasking allows Workers to handle multiple Tasks simultaneously. When enabled (`true`), each Worker can receive parallel reservations up to the per-channel maximums defined in the Workers section. In single-tasking mode (legacy mode), each Worker will only receive a new reservation when the previous task is completed. Learn more at [Multitasking](https://www.twilio.com/docs/taskrouter/multitasking).

requestBody.name: Template
requestBody.description: An available template name. Can be: `NONE` or `FIFO` and the default is `NONE`. Pre-configures the Workspace with the Workflow and Activities specified in the template. `NONE` will create a Workspace with only a set of default activities. `FIFO` will configure TaskRouter with a set of default activities and a single TaskQueue for first-in, first-out distribution, which can be useful when you are getting started with TaskRouter.

parameters.name: WorkspaceSid
parameters.description: The SID of the Workspace to fetch.

parameters.name: EndDate
parameters.description: Only include usage that occurred on or before this date, specified in GMT as an [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) date-time.

parameters.name: Minutes
parameters.description: Only calculate statistics since this many minutes in the past. The default 15 minutes. This is helpful for displaying statistics for the last 15 minutes, 240 minutes (4 hours), and 480 minutes (8 hours) to see trends.

parameters.name: StartDate
parameters.description: Only calculate statistics from this date and time and later, specified in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.

parameters.name: TaskChannel
parameters.description: Only calculate cumulative statistics on this TaskChannel. Can be the TaskChannel's SID or its `unique_name`, such as `voice`, `sms`, or `default`.

parameters.name: SplitByWaitTime
parameters.description: A comma separated list of values that describes the thresholds, in seconds, to calculate statistics on. For each threshold specified, the number of Tasks canceled and reservations accepted above and below the specified thresholds in seconds are computed. For example, `5,30` would show splits of Tasks that were canceled or accepted before and after 5 seconds and before and after 30 seconds. This can be used to show short abandoned Tasks or Tasks that failed to meet an SLA. TaskRouter will calculate statistics on up to 10,000 Tasks for any given threshold.
